data.text: Ordered steak sandwich on gluten free bun. Bun had been microwave for probably 2 - 3 minutes. It was falling apart in the middle, wet on the outside but also hard and chewey. The steak was mostly grissle. Our server was OK for serving food but then spent best part of 10 minutes talk to one table while we waited for our bill.
data.name: Frank Healy
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Frank Healy,

We're really sorry to hear you were disappointed with your visit to us. We take all guest feedback seriously, and will look into what happened on this occasion. We'd really like the opportunity to turn this around, if you could please call us on 01625526511.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee Team

data.text: Had a great Christmas dinner, the apple pie dessert was terrible however. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.
data.name: Mitchel “mitchymitchy99” Allen-Moors
data.responseFromOwnerText:
We appreciate your review about your recent experience with us! We're really sorry to hear you didn't enjoy your apple pie - however thank you very much for your kind comments regarding our staff and the Christmas dinners - we hope to welcome you back again soon!

The Honey Bee Team

data.text: Four if us chose the festive menu. Drinks came quite quickly but  fod order  took time. Starters if prawn cocktail with salmon had too much lettuce not enough fish  mains took a long time to get there & the carrots were solid, the parsnips very soft, meat was fatty, 8 small potatoes were not roasted, sprouts were tiny, cabbage was crunchy. Xmas pud had very little brandy sauce .All in all not a good meal. Staff were friendly . Toilets are at the end of a safari upstairs, long walk & climb for me. Will not rush back.
data.name: Tony Walker
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Tony Walker,

We're really sorry to hear you were disappointed with your visit to us, it sounds like we really didn't get it right on this occasion. I will pass your comments over to our kitchen team and look into what went wrong during your visit, as this isn't the standard we pride ourselves in offering. If you'd like to discuss this further please do call us on 01625526511. We really hope we get the opportunity to turn this around. In the hope that you return to us, we do have an easy access toilet on the ground floor for those who wish to use it - we will be happy to point this out for you next time.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee

data.text: My wife and I visited the Honey Bee pub/ restaurant on Friday the 8 th of December (2023). Have to say that the food was excellent as was the atmosphere, lots of people eating. The service was great although our waitress referred to my wife and I as “Guys and my lovelies” terms that I can’t stand. The reason why I have given 4 stars is because of the darkness of the car park. Why, oh why isn’t the entrance, from the road, not illuminated?? Then there are lights along the paths from the car park to the door of the pub but, guess what, most of them are out, they are in darkness. Come on Honey Bee, it’s winter, it’s dark, light the outside space up.
data.name: Jon Walker
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we did. We really appreciate your kind comments regarding the food and the atmosphere. Unfortunately at the moment half of the outside lights aren't working and is proving a very extensive to to resolve including rewiring most of the electrics within the pub. I can assure you this is being treated with a matter of urgency, and we hope the electrical contractors will be able to fix soon.

We hope to welcome you back again.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee

data.text: First time at the Honey Bee. We weren't disappointed, food was lovely and Hayley was a great host. Would recommend this place for a lovely evening meal and drinks.

data.text: Had the Sunday roast.  Had to return as cold.  Turkey was quite generous, but beef was somewhat tough and gristly.  Also, temperature of restaurant (far end near fire escape) not warm.

data.responseFromOwnerText:

We are aware the temperature of the pub is quite cold at the moment due to an issue with our fireplaces that we are currently in the process of correcting so I hope in a week or so time, this should be sorted. data.text:
This time we have ordered 2 rump steaks and one was full of fat that I had to give half of my portion to my partner. Then we waited 15 min for plates to be cleared and when asked for dessert menu, waited another 10 min until the guy brings it. He said :"I haven't forgotten ", but he did as he has served about 4 tables with food and drinks before he came to us.
It looked like there was only him, a girl at the bar and one more lady(over 50), who was serving the other side so service was slow. Normally, we are happy, but this time it was disappointing to the point that my partner said he won't come back again. Shame

data.text:
We used to visit the Hartshead. Also run by Vintage Inns but they unfortunately closed. We found The Honey Bee and decided to try it.

It's a lovely looking place from the outside, decent parking and we were welcomed and seated quickly. The person serving us was friendly and informative. That's when it started to go down hill, we ordered our drinks and meals and had waited around 15 mins when they came out to tell us they hadn't got one of our starters and could they swap? A little annoying and definitely not as nice as the starter we had ordered. After they'd cleared our plates we then waited for another 15 minutes when the person serving came out to say they hadn't got one of the mains either. So we had to swap another meal. When we received our meals mine had been clearly waiting for my wife's to be cooked as mine was barely warm and hers was red hot. I didn't mention anything as we really just wanted to get out at this point. We paid £80 for 2 starters and 2 mains and 4 drinks. We had to pay full price for all the items that we didn't really want and they even gave is someone else's bill at the end. No apology as such.

Overall the staff are friendly and the place was welcoming and clean but I expected more on a Friday night in a busy area.

We will try another Vintage Inn soon and hopefully find somewhere as good as the Hartshead.
data.name: Christina Peppard-Hughes
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Christina Peppard-hughes thank you for your honest feedback as this is valuable to our ability to conduct great service and also sheds light on areas we may have further to accomplish. I would love to get some further feedback from you if thats ok? if you have a moment, could you provide me with a few more details such as time you visited, description or name of your server? please email us directly at honeybeewilmslow@vintageinn.co.uk if you get a spare moment. and thank you in advance.

Thank you again, 
Charlii - Assistant Manager

data.text:
Previously, I'd left a good review. The prices have gone ridiculous and don't reflect the service or quality of food. Nearly £17 for Mash and Sausages must be a new one in the North West! The service isn't always great, I feel the staff are definitely underpaid. You can't charge premium money and not give a premium service. The food is hit and miss, some dishes are nice and others aren't great... Its definitely not worth the price. I definitely think you'd improve things by paying a better hourly rate and attracting better staff. Staff aren't knowledgeable about things on the menu and when asking for extras if there's not a manager about and they are unsure they make some excuse up. Its just not a premium brand... Shame really. Prices are creeping to miller and carter prices but by far a much poorer experience in comparison....

Pay peanuts, get monkeys
data.name: Constantinople
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Constantinople,

I'm really sorry to hear you were disappointed with your experience to us  and felt as though our sausages and mash wasn't great value for money. We will pass this over to our menu development team. We also apologize that you feel as though the service is lacking - I'd like to hear more feedback about this so I can address the issues to improve for the future.

If you could call myself on 01625526511 to discuss it would be much appreciated.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee

data.text: There was nothing great. The steamer had broken and we were told that meals came with no vegetables. When I suggested that they could boil the veg in a pan, apparently this was against company policy!! The lamb on the "duo of lamb" was ok but the shepherds pie  was microwaved to an inch of its life and was as dry as dust. No apology of course. We were told that the coffees would take 25mins - issues with the coffee maker!!  No, I shall never return.

If you'd like to call to discuss this further with myself, please call on 01625526511. We really hope we get the opportunity to turn this around.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee

data.text: We went today as a family of 6 for the Father's day set menu. The service from greeting us at the door to paying the bill was faultless. It was very busy but we were so well looked after. We all had the roast and we all loved them. I especially loved the roasted carrots and parsnips. Everyone commented on how delicious the meat was. 3 of us had dessert. Eton mess was heavenly. So light but also indulgent. One of us had sticky toffee pudding and loved it. Even the toilets upstairs are lovely with a view of the front garden and lots of mirrors. Not expensive and we can't wait to come back. Thank you for having us xxx

data.text:
This is the second time here and wow the service is bad!!!

The first time was very quiet and the service was dreadful but we thought we would give it another go and it's much busier this time and it's even worse than the first time!

We have been sitting for awhile before we was given Menu's or asked if we wanted any drinks once the food was ordered and it arrived it was slammed down or past a very hot plate with no warning!!

Unfortunately we won't be coming again.  VERY POOR SERVICE FOOD WAS GOOD BUT IT DEFINITELY DOESN'T OUTWEIGH THE POOR SERVICE!!!

data.text:
Very disappointing, my husband ordered a sirloin steak I ordered the pie of the day, the waitress said the pie of the day was chicken and leak, when we ordered I asked the girl for the pie of the day she said it was beef in red wine, which I ordered , when the meals arrived they looked very nice but when I cut through the puff pastry which was mainly air at the bottom of the dish was 2 pieces of meat with a tiny bit of gravy, I think for £14-50 is was disgraceful, when the young waitress came over to ask if all was ok I explained that I had never seen a pie like it, she took it back to the kitchen, another lady came over I presume she was the manager, she said the pies are all fresh which wasn’t the reason I had complained about and that she couldn’t guarantee if I ordered it again it could possibly be the same, I ended up ordering the steak the same as my husband was eating as I new from what he said that that was ok, the price of this was £18-50, but  by the time my meal came my husband had finished he’s .
No apology or anything.
Not a nice evening at all.
data.name: Janice Latham
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Janice Latham,

I'm really sorry you were disappointed with your visit to us on Saturday 1st April, I also apologise that you felt your complaint wasn't dealt with efficiently at the time, we organised a replacement meal as quickly as possible due to the disappointment with the pie, however the well done steak did take a while to cook hence the delay in the replacement dish arriving, I truly am sorry if this spoilt your evening and really hope this doesn't put you off returning.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee

data.text:
If you are a vegetarian I would say avoid this place.  There is hardly any choice, and why is it a meat eating person who has lasagne gets the choice of chips or salad, but a vegetarian having a veggie lasagne only has the option to have salad, and chips have to be paid for as an extra. The veggie lasagne looked like grey slime, really not appetising at all. We had some cheese starter things, they were disgusting, just cold soggy cheese, and one of them didn't even have any cheese in, just an empty parcel thing. We couldn't eat it, and so tried the mushrooms instead, they were certainly piping hot (bubbling hot), and quite nice, but the toast that came with them was only toasted on one side.   When I made my complaint on the lasagne, I was asked if I would like anything else, but there was no other vegetarian option, so I said it's fine I will just eat the chips, the manageress then had the cheek as she walked away to say "enjoy your food" What!! A plate of chips!!
I certainly won't be going back.
data.name: Justine Brito-Hilton
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Justine Brito-hilton,
I'm really sorry to hear you were disappointed with our vegetarian options, we do have our vegan penang curry, a vegetarian burger, a pizza and also a choice of salads for our vegetarian guests, along with several vegetarian starters including the arrancini, the soup, mushrooms, Camembert bites and sharing Camembert, however I will pass the feedback over to our menu development team to take into account when launching our new summer menu. If you'd like to discuss anything further, please don't hesitate to contact myself on 01625526511.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee

data.text:
Unfortunately I will not be recommending The Honey Bee to anyone else or be visiting again.  When we arrived it took over 15 minutes for someone to come and take our drinks order and then another 15 minutes for the drinks to arrive at our table.   We then asked for a straw which never arrived.

Out starters were ok and probably the only part of the meal that we enjoyed.

Unfortunately our mains arrived even though our table had not been cleared of our starters.  We then had out mains but had to wait for more cutlery before we could start eating.

The mains - two of use ordered the Sunday trio and one ordered the beef in chianti .  The beef was  advertised that it came with tender stem broccoli however normal broccoli was served.  All the veg was overcook and seemed waterlogged (similar to frozen veg), the roast potatoes were closer to boiled potatoes, no where near roasted!.   All the food on the Sunday Trio's was cold! Beef stew was hot though.
The cauliflower cheese was lacking the cheese sauce, it seemed like it was over cooked cauliflower with a sprinkling of cheese on top.

All in all it was a very disappointing experience from the service to the quality of the food.

data.text: My son took myself and my wife, his mother, this was the first time I visited, he took us as a thank you for all the time we aford himself and partner helping with child care n stuff, they are both hard working and like us all struggling a little. So first impressions, yes nice place in nice grounds, Inside very pleasant, Now I do not wish to be too hard here, but 2 pints a glass of wine and a small coke from the pump, £18.00!  we ordered our meals and a few starters, well 5 prawns and 2 scollops and a little drizzled sauce not value for money, so main orders came served by very young staff! apparently the pub has recently been taken over very recently, however take over any business and you need to be hitting the ground running, I ordered rack of lamb! 3 very thin lamb chops luke warm, mange tout luke warm, small jug of gravy cold, also a small put vessel like a shepperds pie, so hot I was surprised It was supposed to have toasted bread! none came so it was requested that it had not been put with the meal, the waited said it did not come with it! My wife showed him the menue and clearly stated it did, so I ate my luke warm food finished it as we had waited long enough and did not want to wait to have a it microwaved! the the waiter brought out a bread batton, not toasted and no butter! out of 6 meals the 7 yr old only had the garlic bread and left what seemed like a full tin of pease in a pot bowl, and the fish,  4 out of 6 meals were not acceptable.  Two were rib eye steak, these were very fatty and quite a lot was left as fatty, for a cut of steak that is supposed to be the better part of the animal, left was 30 to 50%? and £44.00 for two steak dinners !!!!  Now I am not saying I will not eat there again, but maybe ill stick to Deckers at Sale Water Park.  first impressions do last and my son took us there with his children, as he had eaten there before it was taken over. why take us there, because then it was in his words a lovely meal and service. My son did make it known to the new landlord, and I do hope it improves. I think next week I will invite my son and his partner to my home and I will cook a Lamb Kalleftico.

 We regret that you weren't satisfied with your experience. We hope you will give us another chance. Please call us at 01625 526511 so we can work towards a solution. Thank you and have a great day.

data.text: Ok firstly party of 6 arriving at separate times in 3s made to sit at a table when our party was already sat somewhere else. Staff have no idea whats going on. We join our party after they come and find us and say what are you doing sat here…. The food omg if your paying this price for this rubbish microwave processed food you need your head testing. Never returning ourselves heard it was a good place to go and they were busy but believe me when you eat out a-lot you quickly realise how poor this place is and the food quality is that of weather-spoons quality . We are so grateful that our company and gathering made the evening and never will we return to be overcharged for frozen food. We worked out the bill as they were unable to split it and found a service charge of £26 which i refused to pay given cutlery was placed on the table in a pile sort yourself out and staff are serving drinks and food over peoples heads rather than walking round. Clearly not trained and not there fault as they haven’t been taught I’ve given one star but really worthy of none.  No training, food is appalling people that go here really haven’t experienced the finer side of dinning for the same price and in some cases cheaper. We can eat at 5star for less money and better quality food and service. If you want weatherspoons food at afluente prices then this is the place to get ripped off….

data.text:
There were nine of us. We were greeted very courteously. Then things went pear shape. I aske two separate members of staff for an extra knife and fork . I had booked for nine but the table was laid for eight. I never got one.
My sister in law has mouth cancer and can only have soup. We asked if it could be whisked up like a puree and he said he didn't think so. She asked if they had an electric mixer to puree it, and he said he didn't think they had. It did arrive pureed. I used her knife and fork.
The meals were lovely, but the mini puddings and coffee took so long two members had to leave and only had coffee.  We were sitting on the table that leads from the bar to the main restaurant. It was very cold.
I have been three times in three weeks and it has been lovely. I would definitely recommend you to my friends.
We arrived at 11,30am , it wasn't open and we had to wait till nearly 11,40am. I have Osteopenia ( crumbling discs) and standing waiting to open didn't dp my back any good.
Eileen Lees
data.name: Eileen Lees
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hello Eileen,

data.text: Visited for the first time on 12th August. We sat outside and ordered chicken wings and the king prawn cocktail for starter. For main we ordered a meat feast pizza and a signature burger. My first issue was the fact you get 3 chicken wings. I understand the point of it being a starter but £6.50 for this felt very steep - given so little amount. The other starter issue was the fact the king prawns were not king prawns and instead lots of standard prawns, which my partner was not so pleased with. The burger they had was average. The pizza was asked to have no chutney and it came with it on. I asked for this to be changed, but by the time it came, my partner had finished their burger. Which meant I had to awkwardly eat while they had finished. Finally their seemed to be an issue with the soft drinks, it was very flat and after it being changed it was still the same so I just made do with it. Other people also mentioned this so I'm not sure what the issue with soft drinks was. Over all I felt slightly let down with the whole visit, given that we paid just shy of £50 for 2 courses and a drink each.

data.text:
This is a pub that is very well situated and ought to be absolutely amazing and when they offer a menu they should provide the food as it’s described, My issue is when I order a meat feast pizza I don’t expect pizza pizza bread sprinkled with a few offcuts of chicken a few offcuts of pork and something called fennel sausage dust! they need to get there menu in line with the food that is offered as a chicken pizza it was fine but as a meat feast pizza it was woefully inadequate and the £13.50 I was charged was probably twice but it was worth therefore I won’t be going back and that’s disappointing!

Don’t order a pizza in a pub I think theres a lesson learned if you want a pizza go to the Italian restaurant if you want pub group go to a pub, I hope there other food meets the description

I will pass your feedback into our menu development team, I hope this doesn't deter you from visiting again in the future.

Kindest Regards
The Honey Bee Team

data.text:
Hmmmm.....disappointing 😔
When we pulled up I thought it looked like a lovely place.  You can order food and drinks from your table.  We ordered the chicken sandwich and I had the fish finger sandwich with a portion of onion rings on the side.  The food did take a while to come which I don't mind as I'm assuming it's cooked fresh to order.  The fish fingers were mainly batter. I couldn't see hardly any fish inside and what I could see was grey. It was very dry as it was in ciabatta which had a lot of flour underneath.  The chips were nice but the onion rings were incredibly greasy....yuk! Felt disappointed.  My partner thought the chicken sandwich was okay.
Improvements are needed for sure.

data.responseFromOwnerText:

I'm really sorry to hear you were disappointed with your  visit to us here at The Honey Bee. data.text:
We visited on Easter Sunday for breakfast after a wedding the night before. Staff were friendly and the place was cosy and quaint, a lovely venue.

Maybe the kitchen wasnt ready or they were short staffed, as we, 7 of us, were the first table there, but it took almost 40 minutes for our food to arrive. Unfortunately, my poached eggs for my eggs florentine came hard boiled, so had to wait longer for them to remake them, but it was good once corrected, it was surprising as 3 others ordered eggs benedict and came out lovely and runny.

Not too sure why the Eggs Florentine was 30p more expensive than Eggs Benedict, when the only difference is it's spinach (menu says buttered spinach but it was just wilted spinach) instead of ham 🤷‍♂️
data.name: Andrew Cheung
data.responseFromOwnerText:

Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. The Honey Bee team.

Regarding our cask range, we do only offer doom bar on our drinks menu which was on yesterday, we have recently been trying a few different cask ales which we will continue to do in the future, however, this week we didn't manage to get any others in.

data.text:
I am truly disheartened to leave this review because this has always been my favourite place to dine, I love the atmosphere of the place and couldn't get quality of food any better but unfortunately my last visit after not being able to go for a while was very disappointing, the menu has changed a lot which I had expected,  I ordered the King prawns & Scallops for my starter which in hindsight I should have realised wouldn't match the description because when I asked the waitress if the prawns had the heads & tails on she slightly laughed as she said no.. I soon realised why.. the prawns were so tiny and overcooked and probably about 8 of them and the scallops were the size of maybe a 20p piece and there was 2 of them.. this was £9.50 I couldn't believe it, I ordered gammon for my main to which I was told they don't serve with pineapple just with eggs & triple cooked chips... the gammon was really really salty, I know gammon is very salty anyway but this was overkill, the yolks of the eggs were like bullets and the "triple" cooked chips looked like they hadn't even been properly cooked once they were anaemic, so so disappointing, I did tell the waitress when she asked if everything was satisfactory to which she apologised and offered a complimentary desert, what I actually wanted was another main as this trip cost me & my partner £72 and I was still hungry, I declined it.
Standards and quality have really slipped.. what a shame...

If you wish to discuss this further with myself please don't hesitate to contact me on 01625526511.

data.text:
Turned up as walk in at The Honey Bee for Sunday lunch .Although fully booked they took the time to check if they could squeeze us in as a couple. Thankfully they could and what a lovely place. The food we both had starters and Sunday roasts were good and tasty . The staff were all attentive and quite obviously well trained in customer service and all requests by customers were addressed if possible. Lovely log fires and ambience was great.
Would certainly visit again but do recommend booking as I feel we were lucky to be accepted as Walk ins

The Honey Bee

data.text: Don’t bother going here if you are vegetarian. We visited last night (Sunday) as we are staying nearby. At 6pm they had ran out of the vegetarian roast, which left me with the option of an unimaginative vegetarian burger. When I asked if they could give me a couple of more veggie options I was told they could do me the burger or ‘a roast without the meat’ - so a plate of side veg for my main meal, erm no thanks! Went with the only option of the burger which was distinctly average. Husband says his trio of roast (which was actually only a due as they had also ran out of turkey) was also average. Overpriced for what you get. Won’t be back.

If you would like to discuss this matter further then please do not hesitate to contact us so that we may pass on your direct feedback to our IT department for them to look into and hopefully provide some answers as to what had happened on this occasion. If you would like to contact us via telephone on 01625 526511 a member of the management team would be more than happy to assist.

Kindest regards,

The Honey Bee Team

data.text:
Great country pub vibes the honey bee. Visited today with my mum for Sunday lunch. As it’s valentines weekend we pre booked ahead of our visit, we arrived slightly  ahead of time and we were escorted to our table.
The pub is very cozy, it has real log burning fires which were lit! Perfect for a rainy cold Day in the uk.
I had the serloin of beef Sunday roast and mum had the trio of roasts, with a side of mash. The portion size is very generous and the food was delicious. Would highly recommend especially if you are visiting or living  around the area. It is a great location about 10 minutes drive from Manchester airport.

data.text: We booked for our daughters 21st birthday meal for a party of 10. We booked 2 weeks in advance so plenty of notice.  On arrival the car park was full with people parking on verges,  we had to queue to go in as it was very busy.  Some of the starters ordered were not what was listed on the menu so we had to send back. The mains were not good as we had to request vegetables that were hot as the ones we were served were cold. Also my geandsons burger was served with salad on the bun so he refused to eat it. We had requested no salad but this was not adhered to. The manager did apologise but did not offer any incentive for us to carry on our meal and order desserts. We asked for the birthday cake paid the bill and left.  We did make several complaints during the meal when we could get someones attention. The restaurant was over subscribed and under staffed. Will not be going back in a hurry.

data.text:
Not been in for a while so our return visit was pleasing. Good wines and a warm welcome from the bar staff. Courtney was amazing.
It still looks the same. Cosy country pub feel. And the menu looked good though we didn't have time to eat on this fleeting visit.
We will definitely return!
data.name: Rachel C
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Rachel  Thanks for your review. You summed up exactly the feel we aim for.  See you again soon.  Kind Regards Carl

data.text:
The pub itself is really nice, but everything else not so much.

I booked a table for 3 of us on Sunday. We arrived and we stood there a good while before we were acknowledged by one of the bar staff. Everyone else just walked past, looked at us and carried on walking. The man behind the bar asked us if we had a table booked. I said yes. He then abruptly said " stand back over there " as though I was in the way. We eventually got seated and ordered our food.

It was very disappointing. The cut of meat I had was poor and full of Grissel and the roast potatoes weren't even roasted properly. They were quite hard and a bit oily. We didn't even bother with the desert menu.

When it came time to pay, I walked up to the bar and I used my card. The lady who took my payment didn't smile, say thank you or see you again or anything. Just took my payment and walked off!

First and last time I will be going there.

data.text:
Good:
Easy to find with good access. Staff were all friendly to us and there is a good choice of food. Garden is nice to sit in and the road noise isn't too bad.

Bad:
£16 for a burger is steep, I was expecting a lot and honestly was left disappointed. Burger was dry and the bacon rock solid, didn't detect any pulled beef in it either... maybe i was just unlucky. The chips were good although a small portion.
My partners lobster fish cakes were OK but also nothing to shout about.

The best meal was the kids lasagne which came with veg and mash, in fact her kids meal was as big as our main meals and a third of the price.

Ultimately maybe we just got unlucky with the food, or saw the reviews and prices and expected too much.
data.name: Rusty 87
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Rusty,I'm sorry to hear you were dissapointed during your visit to us here at The Honey Bee. We're pleased to hear your kind comments regarding the members of the team, I apologize you felt the food didn't meet your expectations. If you'd like to discuss this further with myself please don't hesitate to call on 01625526511 and I'll be happy to look into this further.Kindest RegardsThe Honey Bee Team

data.text: Lovely location, superb beer garden. Food was good but a little expensive. Paid £40 (Inc tip) for one shandy, one lemonade and 2 burgers. Would definitely go back.

data.text:
I went with a friend planning to go for dinner. It was very very humid and we were not allowed to eat outside due to staff shortages.
So we were forced to eat in a very cramped restaurant with no air con.
The duty manager on was clearly not happy with the situation and was very rude.
We left without eating or ordering.
I will not be going back to the honey bee.
data.name: Stephanie King
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Stephanie, Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review regarding your recent visit to The Honey Bee. We are sorry that your visit did not meet expectations on this occasion and that you were unable to dine with us outside in our garden area. We ask that you accept our sincere apologies that we could not meet your expectations regarding this matter. If you wish to discuss your visit further then please do not hesitate to call us on 01625 526511. Kindest regards, The Honey Bee

data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Delita, Thank you for your 5* review! We are happy to see that you enjoyed your time spent at The Honey Bee and we cant wait to welcome you back very soon. Kindest regards, The Honey Bee Team

data.text: Made arrangements for a group of 15, we sat *outside* and was told we had to be in groups of 6 and they don't serve food outside! The server had an extremely grumpy attitude. We all left and went to The Frozen Mop, where we were all seated together, outside and had delicious food and drinks. We won't be going back to the Honey Bee...
data.name: Sharon Harrison
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Sharon,I apologise you were disappointed with your experience here at The Honey Bee. Upon booking, we made it clear that you would all be required to sit in groups of six whether indoors or out, as that is our company policy. Unfortunately these are the restrictions we are currently following and the manager on duty was trying to explain this in the politest way possible. If you'd like to discuss this further please don't hesitate to call me on 01625526511.Kindest RegardsThe Honey Bee Management

data.text: Yesterday, i the pleasure of eating in this delightful pub. I had the fish & chips, which was just perfect, my mum had the salmon, which was excellent. Beautiful surroundings, lovely, very efficient staff. We will be returning here very soon .

data.text: Lovely lasagne with special bread & triple cooked chips. Beautiful surroundings, excellent service. Really nice toilets good views when washing hands, plus both hand dryer worked very efficiently. Tricky when driving out if you don't drive fast, because the speed of the cars coming around blind corner think there on a race trace, if your turning right. But don't let that put you off, because the garden are lovely to sit in, with comfort chairs, all spot on, well done Honey Bee.

data.text: Food wasn't hot was lukewarm , felt like it had been sat around for a while as the gravy itself on the plate was set on the edges, roast potatoes were rubbish very dry and hard not freshly cooked tasted warmed up. Same with parsnips, food was pretty bland lack of flavour, broccoli under cooked (crunchy) Yorkshires were ok, dessert was nice we had apple pies and brownies no complaints there. Service was abit slow staff are nice and friendly just a shame about the Sunday roasts. Always wanted to try this place as it's very nice looking but disappointed and won't be coming back sorry.

Very poor, could not download the app, staff very unhelpful, five of us left without being able to order food or drink.
You replied to this post. Let me make it clear it was not that we didn't what to use the app we couldn't it would have let us book for Christmas dinner, the staff told us when we went inside for help that we could only order with the app.
data.name: Claire Rawji
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Claire,I'm really sorry to hear of your disappointing experience. At the moment, we are encouraging guests to use the order at the table app for outdoor service however we have staff available for those who would prefer full table service, we would have been more than happy to help and take your order from the table had we known you weren't comfortable using the app. I do apologise you left us without any drinks or food, please rest assured all our staff are more than happy to help and that this wouldn't be repeated if you choose to visit us again.Kindest RegardsThe Honey Bee

data.text: Pub very cosy, beautifully decorated with well spaced, comfy seating. Very clean with ample sanitisation stations. Toilets immaculate too. Our server even questioned and went to double check the fruit crumble ingredients despite it being listed on the allergy information as ok. Top marks!!! Thank you :)

data.text: Booked on phone through google the day before for lunch, easy to do. As I booked with phone track and trace was automatically done. 2 car parks to rear and outdoor tables in garden. Beautiful, large stylish pub with a mixture of old + new decor with a cosy relaxing ambience. Lots of little nooks and cranny seating areas which I think gives it chatacter. Toilets upstairs but assume they have disabled on ground floor but not sure.  Hand gel on entrance + throughout pub. Staff ask you to use hand gel before allowing you in the pub, which is good, then explain that you wear your masks at all times walking around pub(to + from table entering + leaving premises + to + from toilet) once seated you can remove mask. Staff take you to your table and it is all table service. All staff wore masks at all times, kept a good safe distance from you, polite, professional and friendly. Cleaned tables as soon as customers left. Good menu choice for meat eaters but not as big a choice for veggies. I'm not a true veggie as I eat fish now + then if the veggie options aren't to my likening. Hubby & I  both had fish gougion sandwich which come with a choice of chunky chips or fries, fish in a light batter with a little tartar sauce already on bread but no garnish on sandwich or plate but that didn't matter. Delicious and quite filling. The mini puds menu was just enough for me but you only get 3 choices from main menu with a cup of coffee, so I had the pud(choccie brownie + ice cream, rich + yummy) + hubby had the coffee. Would definitely recommend.

data.text: Food was decent and nice service. We had booked for 8 people but didn't realise this included babies so when we arrived with a baby they couldn't accommodate this due to their covid risk assessment. Whilst we understood it was a shame they couldn't split us to 2 tables or fit in one extra baby in a pram!
data.name: Fran Schofield
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Fran,We apologise for the disappointment yesterday, as explained on the day unfortunately the maximum number of people we can accommodate per booking is 8, as stated on our website when booking a table. As mentioned on the day, the only other table we had available was a table for 2 which you were more than welcome to have however unfortunately there wasn’t space for the pram on this particular table whilst still keeping 1.5 meters between our guests. We do apologise for any inconvenience this caused.We do hope you return to us again in the future.Kindest regards,The Honey Bee

data.name: philip knight
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Phillip,We’re pleased you enjoyed your lunch with us. Just to let you know we are extending the 50% off scheme however it will work slightly different. You will need to download the vintage inn app and sign up to be issued a code which you will need to bring along with you (this sign up must be done in advance of your booking, not just on the day). This will give you 50% off main meals for up to 6 people, however can not be used with any other offer or promotion.We look forward to hopefully seeing you again soon.The Honey Bee Team

data.text:
Food was very poor. 1 starter sent back and 2 mains which were pretty inedible. Dessert was OK! The food feels like its stood all day and then just reheated and has very little flavour. If you like nice well cooked fresh food... don't eat here.
Tables not very distanced either so felt uncomfortable being so close to adjacent table.
On the plus side... the staff are lovely. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful, and the other staff are too.
Such a shame they can't provide nice quality meals.
data.name: Sarah Crick
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Sarah,We’re sorry you didn’t enjoy your food during your visit to us. As discussed over the phone and via email, we apologise that your friend didn’t enjoy her starter however we were not aware there were any other issues during your meal as we would have been happy to resolve the issue at the time, so please accept our apologies for not picking up on this during your visit. All of our tables are distanced 1.5 meters apart (from table edge to table edge) in line with our specific Covid 19 risk assessment and all our staff are wearing face coverings to ensure our guests feel safe so I apologise if you felt uncomfortable. Please feel rest assured that if any of our guests are unhappy with their table, we would be more than happy to find a table in a different part of our restaurant in order for you to enjoy your experience more. Thank you for your kind comments regarding the staff, our staff do their best to ensure our guests have an enjoyable experience however I apologise that on this occasion, the food let you down. If you’d like to discuss this further with myself, please do not hesitate to contact myself on 01625526511.Kindest regards,The Honey Bee

data.text: We sat outside in the lovely beer garden. The tables were spaced out. The food was ok. We had a side order of cauliflower cheese and mash potatoes.  I was very disappointed with the portion size of the potatoes considering how cheap they are.  I was also surprised that they weren't using individual sachets of salt and pepper.  The staff were very nice and friendly.
data.name: Caroline Stott
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Caroline,Thank you for your kind feedback regarding our friendly members of staff. We apologise you were disappointed with the portion size of your mashed potatoes, as a brand we are given weights and specifications to use which we follow however I will feed your comments back to our menu developers to take into consideration in the future. We are still using our salt and pepper shakers however they are sanitised after ever use. We hope you join us again in the future, hopefully we'll have plenty of nice whether to make the most of the beer garden for a little while longer.Kindest Regards,The Honey Bee

data.text: If you haven't visited then you definitely should! Gorgeous food, lovely relaxed atmosphere, and the staff are so friendly! Very covid safe place this, we have been twice in the last two weeks, book a table, you won't be disappointed!

data.text: First visit for us today for a long time.  The lunchtime fish and chips, hunters chicken and pizza were really nice but I had the chicken, mozzarella and bacon sandwich and sweet potato fries that wasn't.  The chicken and bacon was very dry and tough, and the fries were over cooked.  The service was very good, but very slow. Only two members of staff on for a very busy lunchtime.  Happy to go again and try something different.

data.text: Booked a table for 7 people at 18 hours , (my husband's belated birthday meal)firstly the drinks were ordered,10 minutes later ,no drinks!! My daughter had to collect them from a tray on the bar!!!.our food order was taken from a very helpful waitress,nearly 50 minutes !! LATER  our food was brought to us ,two Sunday roasts were almost cold and one Wagyu burger was presented with an additive that was specifically! NOT asked to be included.I approached the manager and voiced my disappointment,he told me that there would be no charge for any of the meals and apologised,fair enough,however ,this does not really compensate  for the ruined evening,if seven meals cannot be presented without a significant delay ,and without  two being unfit to eat,then perhaps you should only take bookings for 4 or less.the waitress was not at fault.

data.responseFromOwnerText: Julie Hardman, we're disappointed to hear of the negative experience you had at our location. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again. Please contact us at 01625 526511 if you would like to discuss the matter further. Thank you again for taking the time to give us this feedback. Warm regards

data.text: My partner ordered, I never went up to the bar but he did mention the guy that served him was very rude and blunt and spoke in as little words as he could. Our mains were not amazing and desserts were not great either. Custard had a film over it, as though it had been left for a while and the brownie was crumbly and tasted shop bought (bought at a very good price though). Beautiful place form the outside, went in on a whim. Would not go back.

data.text:
Do like the ambience here and a good menu.
Would have liked to have seen the fire lit on a cold evening. Also we sat at the table next to the fire which was very drafty from the window behind. We asked to be moved eventually which wasn't a problem.
Drinks came after our meal was delivered and we did have to remind waitress. Bar very busy. Maybe short staffed but staff very friendly.
We all enjoyed our food and would visit again.

data.text: Oh dear, very poor service. Arrived. Told by the barman to choose a table of our choice and we would have a waitress service. Waited for around 20 mins with no one tending to us. The over ambience of the place was a little up itself in true reflection and the saving grace was the dog friendly policy they had in place. However, Very rude and the menu could do with a revamp when looking and trying to choose our choice of meal. Family of 4, 2 adults and 2 children.

data.text:
Went to the Honey Bee. We sat down and waited 15 minutes, eventually a waitress came and asked if we had seated ourselves then asked us to move because “the table was booked for 1 hour later and she doubted we would even have been served by then” so we left and didn’t even have the drinks order taken.
1) there was no sign to say we had to wait to be seated
2) there was no sign to say the table was reserved
3) why would it be over an hour before the food came out?

Wouldn’t go back. Very poor service

data.text: Part of the Vintage Inns group. Nice spot for a business dinner or a family Sunday lunch. When it’s sunny sitting outside is great with a large beer garden and plenty of room for the kids to play. Good spot with plenty of drinks on sale and a large menu to choose from.

data.text: poor service and food to match. we couldn’t get any service from our table, so we went to the bar to order drinks.  We were told to return to our table and someone would take our order there. 20 minutes later, nobody came. Later on, we caught the attention of a waitress to try and order drinks.  She said someone would come to take our order. nobody came. starters took 1 hour, as did the mains, no problem for us, but we were expelled from table before dessert because it was booked by others. we would have finished and gone if not for the shoddy service we had all night on food and drinks. neither of which were worth the wait. living on past reputation maybe???

data.text:
Lovely pub in a lovely setting. Plenty of seating both indoor and outdoor.

Service was excellent throughout our visit with special mention to the young eastern european server who was extremely patient with the 11 of us.

No complaints about the food from anyone and we had a mix of roasts, burgers, steak, hunters chicken and couple of kids meals that were all reasonably priced.

Overall a pleasant visit and we are likely to be back. 😁

data.text: Lovely pub on the outskirts of Wilmslow with outdoor seating for drinks and a separate area for alfresco dining. Inside exudes a cosy charm with characterful seating and a range of tables. There is a separate dining area for full table dinners while the bar area offers a great menu with a special lunchtime set menu at an attractive price for either two or three courses. The food was excellent and there is a great range of hand pulled real ales, draught lagers as well as an excellent wines and spirits.

data.text: I visited here with a colleague on Friday 13th July intending to have lunch and a couple of drinks. The opening hours are clearly stated on the official website and the front door as 11.00AM to 11.00PM. We arrived at 11.10AM. The doors were locked and although there were a number of staff cars in the car park we could not attract anyone's attention to check the opening hours. By 11:20 there were about 5 or 6 people waiting outside who then all left. Pretty disgraceful really.
data.name: Tony Marshall
data.responseFromOwnerText: Tony Marshall, we're disappointed to hear of the negative experience you had at our location. Our opening times are 11.30am until 11pm. data.text: Excellent establishment! If you are looking to eat here you can eat either inside which will be a Tab service or outside on the glass topped tables which is a cash service. Unfortunately the honey bee management only permit eating outside if you are at a glass topped table, this does mean a short wait until one becomes available on busier summer days. The fish and triple cooked chips are excellent! Just a stones throw away from Manchester International Airport so if you tie it in with a trip to an airport viewing park the kids are sure to have an excellent day out! Great selection of beer and wine too!

Yorkshire pudding so hard it would make a great weapon.

data.text:
An interesting visit on Christmas Day. We arrived in time, then were kept waiting for an hour and 40 minutes before the manager gave up and sat us at a high table on stools near the toilets that had previously been a waiting area.

Overall the food was good but the roast turkey was not. It was poorly seasoned and used instant gravy.  We had no condiments to season it ourselves.  The rest of the food was excellent.

The bar does not stock any interesting craft beers as this is a typical chain pub. The beer they did have was well kept as there are a cask marquis monitored pub.

The décor and atmosphere of this place is excellent with a large outdoor seating area. The carpark did not have enough spaces when we went, but this may not be typical as it was Christmas day.

The manager, who does not usually work there, could not be faulted, he was extremely apologetic, bringing us free drinks and then refunding us the cost of the meal. As a result of this the star rating it's based on the quality of the food and beer we had.

James Team Leader

data.text: Delicious food, same prices as crappy hotel restaurant. Hugely recommend this place, for the cost of a two minute drive, you'll have better food at a better price with much better service. Well done.

data.text: Really nice pub, great atmosphere and food.

data.text: Fantastic menu. We always go here for a meal before heading to Manchester airport.

data.text: Food was fine, but service was slow. Seemed to wait an age to be 'booked in' with no one acknowledging we were waiting. Slow taking the order, and again when leaving no 'thanks' or 'bye' from any of the staff.
data.name: Mark Crossley

data.text:
A really lovely Vintage Inn pub with a nice atmosphere.  Lots of choice of alcohol and the standard vintage Inn menu.

Lots of seating inside and out and a good size car park.

Recommended!
data.name: Tony Jones

data.text: Top food. Nice pub

data.text: Very good choice of good and well cooked

data.text: Always great
data.name: Andrew Henshaw

data.text: Better choice around, but okay.
data.name: Stephanie

data.text: Visited the Honey Bee today, this place is big! The gardens are excellent and the interior is homely.  I was a little disappointed not to see a mixed grill on the menu but the hunters chicken was delightful and the staff were very helpful. A true treasure this place, well worth a short drive to visit.
data.name: David Gavin

data.text:
Only went back as we hoped the refurb meant things would have improved.  Still have to wait 10-15 mins at the bar to get served whilst other staff swan around chatting.

Although compared to the food the service is the least of their problems.  After sending one meal back and complaining about another we did get one meal refunded.  Still left one meal virtually uneaten and the other that was sent back arrived after everyone else had finished.

"managers" have no idea, will not be going back.

Shame as they have done the place up and it looks so much better.
data.name: Helen Paterson (Mrs P)

data.text: Things are improving ,we used to visit regularly with the family until about two years ago. We stopped going because the food was unimpressive. However we  tried it again recently and will definitely  go back. Lovely atmosphere pleasant service better food
data.name: seamus king

data.text: One of the nicest pubs I've visited. Although not the best atmosphere, a lot of money has clearly been spent on the outside spaces and the finish inside. A touch above the everyday pub you go to for a meal. Food was also nice, and a great pint of Guinness. I'll be back next time in in the area
data.name: Sean Murphy

data.text: Great place to replenish fluids and participate in grazing on human food. Nice friendly staff to boot
data.name: Chris Lamb

data.text:
I don't like to be asked if I want to tip when I pay buy card and especially when you pay before the food.
Glad I didn't tip, the driest chicken I've ever had.
Chips means frozen fries. You pay extra for "chunky chips" which I bet are just frozen regular chips, but I didn't pay that as I expected chips and not fries.

Basically another "pub" with a wannabe chef serving supermarket freezer dishes.
Not impressed at all and I won't be back.
data.name: Ben Coulthard

data.text: One of my favourite places.
